intro: Mixtecalia teitaensis, commonly known as the Sierra Norte beauty, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It is known for its ornamental value and is often found in specialized botanical gardens. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
